meanings.definition: Opposed to liberal principles or practices
meanings.sent1: The illiberal ruler restricted freedom of speech in the country.
meanings.sent2: Her illiberal views on equality clashed with the inclusive policies of the organization.
meanings.sent3: It was quite illiberal of him to refuse sharing his toys with the other children.
meanings.sent4: The illiberal decision to ban certain books shocked the community.
meanings.sent5: The illiberal laws made it difficult for people to express their opinions freely.

meanings.sent1: His illiberal attitude towards people from different cultures was evident in his remarks.
meanings.sent2: The illiberal group refused to accept anyone who didn't share their beliefs.
meanings.sent3: It's illiberal to judge someone based on their appearance alone.
meanings.sent4: The illiberal behavior of the boss created a hostile work environment.
meanings.sent5: She realized her illiberal thinking was limiting her ability to understand diverse perspectives.

meanings.sent1: The illiberal landlord refused to give any leeway on the rent payment.
meanings.sent2: Her illiberal nature made it hard for her to forgive even the smallest mistakes.
meanings.sent3: It was illiberal of him to demand repayment when he knew she was struggling financially.
meanings.sent4: The illiberal decision to cut funding for the community center left many without support.
meanings.sent5: The illiberal response to the crisis showed a lack of compassion for those in need.
